name: Bulb Boy
description: One gloomy night, Bulb Boy wakes suddenly from a frightening nightmare to discover that evil has overshadowed the Bulbhouse. His family has disappeared and there are horrid monsters lurking in the shadows. Gather the courage and use his glass head to save everything he loves.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7, 8, 8.1, 10 Processor: Intel i3 Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Intel HD 4000

reviews.review_text: Binding of Isaac meets Machinarium. It can't be described better to be honest.

Bulb Boy is a horror/point and click game. Bulb Boy's house is invaded by a monstrosity corrupting everything. The aim is to save his family while surviving the encounters, which are actually quite dynamic for a point'n'click. It is possible to die, but the checkpoints are very frequent so no real loss or frustration. What I found amazing was the diversity in the scenes and interactions. Everything plays differently, and it is very refreshing. Sadly, this also means that the game is quite short (2-3h).   There are some flashback sequences that are less tense and play more like a traditional point'n'click, and are a way to understand where some of the monsters come from. However I did not find them as interesting as the rest of the game, and with the relaxed music accompanying them, they took me out of the atmosphere. The games starts easy and the difficulty ramps up nicely, but I felt like the beginning of the game had more punch and the momentum is gradually lost.  Interactions are simple and easy, movements are smooth for the most part. There is a neat little idea that Bulb Boy can take his head off and either roll it on the floor, or fix it in another receptacle. This creates a lot of variety in the potential interactions that the game can offer. I just regret that some early puzzles can be solved randomly without actually knowing what is the objective yet, but this is a fairly minor concern.  Oh, and yeah, this game is very creepy and gross. Not just the monsters, Bulb Boy himself. If you want a cool and original horror game that controls nicely, its flaws are minor and should not get in your way. I already want more of that stuff from the dev team Bulbware!

I love it! It's cute, unique, the music sets the atmosphere so well. For me, I think it's more leaning to a casual point and click style since the puzzles aren't that too hard to solve (thanks to the hint mechanic), and surprisingly I don't really find it scary.   The only time I actually got scared was the jumpscare in the fridge, and when I'm about to get killed.    Overall it's a great game, it introduces new and unique mechanics and it has that charm that makes you want to keep on playing. For an indie game, I'd say this really worth it. Kudos to the devs for a job well done! My expectations were reached. :) now I just have to unlock all the achievements xD
It's short, and at times very twisted, but it's hard not to like this game. It matches it's twisted sense of humor and style with clever and polished gameplay throughout.
A very stylish, very entertaining point and click. A bit short but otherwise good game! 8/10.

This was a fantastic game and great in every way, my only complaint is for how long this was in development, it ended up on the short side, like VERY short side, I ended up completing it in less than 2 hours, not really sure why it took so long :/.
Decent little game. It's a bit gross but also cute at the same time. Cleared the game within 2 hours, pretty much fun.

What a lovely (and bizzare) game! Charming (and creepy) characters, great graphics, smooth gameplay, good soundtrack and what a wonderful ability to tell stories and direct the story without any use of words. I am easily terrified by anything labelled horror but I was able to play through this game without bursting into tears of terror and sleeping with all the lights on. That being said, there were some tense moments. I'm also not the most able gamer and was able to navigate the more 'active' parts- which honestly gave me quite a boost. Thank you to the developers for considering your less adept audience :). The frequent autosaves at key moments contributed to the enjoyable experience, allowing one to progress, engage and explore the game (almost) fearlessly- no hair was torn out in frustration of having to start from scratch in each level. So thank you for a most enjoyable game!

A cute and overlooked but rather short Point and Click that I didn't know about until I got it randomly in a humble bundle. Most of the puzzles are really easy, and some are just tedious. It's atmosphere was very weird, being a mix of cute and creepy. Overall it was an enjoyable 1.5 hours.

this a very weird game and it's short but oh so sweet. Awesome design, funny, endearing and gross all at the same time, probably the best point and click game I've ever played. Lightbulb/10 would illuminate again.

Bulb Boy is a small horror adventure with charming characters and creepy atmosphere. Bulb Boy is very distinct for its visual, characters and surreal settings. The main character, Bulb Boy, is cute and charming and seems to be innocent yet manacing at the same time. In this point 'n click adventure, you will help Bulb Boy to solve various bizarre puzzles and defeat creepy monsters in order to save his grandpa. Many puzzles are intuitive and creative but there are some that need you to look around aimlessly for interactable objects. Story and settings are quite interesting with several unexpected elements and events that make you surprised and want more. It would be better, however, if the game is satisfyingly long enough for my gaming appetite.
great game kept me at the computer screen till i finished it however i found the game pretty short but I loved the art and the time that was put in to the game now I just wish i had more!!!!!!!!
Dark and disturbing. Creative and entertaining.

It's got some charm, but that doesn't forgive it for being ridiculously short (2.5 hours if you get all the achievements), some frustrating sequences, and a lack of clear direction for many of the puzzles.

Bulb Boy is a Point-and-Click adventure game that's part David Lynch, part Japanese School Girl. Possibly the only game to come out this year that's simultaneously cute and repulsive, don't miss out on it!

It was short but cute, I really enjoyed the music actually. Great for a short bus ride :) I ran into an annoying bug when bulb boy turns into a spider: the mouse seemed to have a mind of its own and I couldn't get bulb boy to go anywhere. Had to restart the game a few times to get through that part.
